title: CFS Data Model Schema version 1.2.0
description: Schema for CFS Data Model version 1.2.0

Version.description: The version number of the data model file.

Schema.description: The version number of the data model schema.

Timestamp.description: The time of generation of the file.

Name.description: The name of the part.

Parts.description: The SoC parts supported by this file.

Name.description: The part name of this SoC.

Package.description: The package used by this SoC. Must correspond to one of the packages described in this file.

MemoryDescription.description: Description of the memory characteristics of the part.

MemoryTypes.description: The type categories of memory used in the UI.

Name.description: The name of the memory type.

Description.description: The description of the memory type.

IsVolatile.description: Whether the memory is volatile or not.

MemoryAliasTypes.description: The potential alias types for memory regions.

Name.description: The name of the memory alias type.

Description.description: The description of the memory alias type.

SystemMemory.description: The system memory available on the SoC.

Cores.description: The cores available on the SoC.

Id.description: The short abbreviation for the core, used as an Id.

Name.description: The name for the core, visible in the UI.

Family.description: The name of the core family e.g. Cortex-M.

CoreNum.description: The ID number of the core, as seen by the hardware.

IsPrimary.description: Whether this is the primary core or not.

Memory.description: The memory ranges visible to the core.

Ai.description: Additional AI-related core information. This property's existence marks it as a supported AI-enabled core.

SupportedOps.description: List of Operators supported on code (empty list means all are supported)

AccelOps.description: List of Operators that can be accelerated (empty list means none are accelerated)

OperatorInfos.description: List of Operators (or Operator classes) that have performance metrics

SupportedDataTypes.description: List of Data types supported (empty list means all are supported

Gaskets.description: The dataflow gaskets on the part.

Name.description: The name of the gasket instance.

Description.description: The description of the gasket instance.

AssociatedCore.description: The core associated with the gasket instance, if any.

Id.description: The id of the gasket instance.

InputBufferSize.description: The size of the input buffer memory in bytes.

MinInputStreamBufferSize.description: The minimum size of an input stream buffer in bytes.

InputAndOutputBuffersTied.description: True if the input and output buffers are tied together, false if they can be assigned separately.

Config.description: The available configuration options for the input stream.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

BuiltInConfig.description: The programming sequences for built-in configuration options for the input stream.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

BufferStart.description: The buffer start address, if fixed.

BufferSize.description: The size of the circular buffer, if fixed.

OutputBufferSize.description: The size of the output buffer memory in bytes.

MinOutputStreamBufferSize.description: The minimum size of an output stream buffer in bytes.

Config.description: The available configuration options for the input stream.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

BuiltInConfig.description: The programming sequences for built-in configuration options for the input stream.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

BufferStart.description: The buffer start address, if fixed.

BufferSize.description: The size of the circular buffer, if fixed.

Config.description: The available configuration options for the gasket.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.
Information on the configuration controls for a configuration tool.

Type.description: The type of values that can be given to the control.

EnumValues.description: The possible values accepted for an enumeration control.

Id.description: The ID of the enumeration value.

Description.description: The description of the enumeration value.

Value.description: The value of the enumeration value.

MinimumValue.description: The minimum value of an input.

MaximumValue.description: The maximum value of an input.

NumericBase.description: The numeric base to use for the input.

Increment.description: The step size for incrementing the value.

Units.description: The units used for integer values.

Condition.description: The condition which must be true for the control should be shown, expressed in reverse Polish notation.

Hint.description: An expression to compute the hint to prepopulate entry boxes.

Pattern.description: A regular expression that a text control input must obey.

ClockNodes.description: Information on the clock ndoes displayed on the canvas. Ordered in the order that code should be emitted.

Name.description: The name of the clock node.

Description.description: The description of the clock node.

Inputs.description: The clock inputs to this node.

Name.description: The name of the clock input.

MinimumValue.description: The minimum value of the input.

MaximumValue.description: The maximum value of the input.

Outputs.description: The clock outputs from this node.

Name.description: The name of the clock output.

Description.description: The description of the clock output.

Value.description: An expression to compute the value of the clock output, expressed in reverse Polish notation.

MinimumValue.description: The minimum value of the output.

MaximumValue.description: The maximum value of the output.

Condition.description: If false, the output is not used. Expressed in reverse Polish notation.

Signpost.description: Information to display in details view to help user understand what to do.

Initialization.description: Information on how to initialize the part when this clock node is active. Often used for oscillators.

Config.description: The available configuration options for the clock node.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

ConfigUIOrder.description: The order for emitting the UI elements, as a list of control names.

ConfigProgrammingOrder.description: The order for emitting the configuration code, as a list of control names.

Name.description: The short name of the peripheral.

ClockNode.description: The name of the ClockNode associated with this peripheral, if any.

Security.description: The security level of the peripheral. Defaults to Any.

Config.description: The available configuration options for the clock node.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

ConfigProgrammingOrder.description: The order for emitting the configuration code as a list of control names.

Signals.description: The list of signals in this peripheral.

Name.description: The short name for the signal.

Required.description: If provided, evaluate this condition to determine if signal is required to be assigned. If not provided, signal is assumed to be required.

Group.description: If provided, this signal is part of a signal group. Each signal group can be allocated to a project independently of the parent peripheral. Multiple signals can be part of the same group.

Cores.description: The cores that can have this peripheral assigned to them.

Preassigned.description: True if we should preassign this peripheral to the core.

Initialization.description: Information on how to initialize the part to use this peripheral.

Group.description: If provided, this peripheral is part of a peripheral group. Peripheral groups allow tools to show them under a common name to simplify UX.

Assignable.description: False if the peripheral cannot be assigned to any core. If not present, it a true value is assumed.

Required.description: List of peripherals. This indicates that those must be properly initialized for this peripheral to work.

Ai.description: AI accelerator related information. This property's existence, marks the peripheral as an AI accelerator.

Name.description: The name of the register, all upper case.

Address.description: The address of the register in hexadecimal.

Size.description: The size of the register in bits.

Name.description: The name of the field, all upper case.

Position.description: The bit position of the field within the register.

Length.description: The length of the field, in bits.

Reset.description: The reset value of the field.

Enum.description: The possible enumeration values that this field can take.

Name.description: The name of the enum identifier, all upper case.

Description.description: The description of the enum identifier.

Documentation.description: The documentation for the enum identifier.

Value.description: The value of this enumeration identifier.

Svg.description: The name of the svg file for the register.

Packages.description: The packages for the part in this file.

Name.description: The short name of the package.

NumPins.description: The number of pins in the package.

Pins.description: The definition of the package pins.

Name.description: The pin name.

Label.description: The label to attach to the pin.

Position.description: The position of the pin on the package.

X.description: The x coordinate of the pin on the canvas.

Y.description: The y coordinate of the pin on the canvas.

Shape.description: The physical shape of the pin.

GPIOName.description: The GPIO port name, if GPIO. Refers to the GPIO peripheral instance.

GPIOPort.description: The GPIO port number or letter, if GPIO.

GPIOPin.description: The GPIO pin number on the port, if GPIO.

Signals.description: The list of signals that can be assigned to the pin.

Peripheral.description: The short name of the peripheral. Must match the name used in the peripherals section.

Name.description: The short name of the signal. Must match the name used in the peripherals section.

PinMuxSlot.description: The number of the pin mux function, if pin muxed.

PinMuxConfig.description: Information on how to configure the part to use this signal.

PinConfig.description: The available configuration options for the pin and signal.

ConfigProgrammingOrder.description: The order for emitting the configuration code as a list of control names.

IsInputTap.description: True if this signal is an input tap, which means it can be assigned in parallel with other signals on this pin.

CoprogrammedSignals.description: Groups of signals/pins that must be selected together.

items.description: Group of signals/pins that must be selected together.

Pin.description: The pin name where the signal must be selected.

Peripheral.description: The short name of the peripheral. Must match the name used in the peripherals section.

Signal.description: The short name of the signal. Must match the name used in the peripherals section.

PinCanvas.description: The definition of the package canvas.

Width.description: The width of the canvas, in number of pins.

Height.description: The height of the canvas, in number of pins.

Labels.description: A list of labels to place on or around the canvas.

X.description: The x coordinate of the label on the canvas.

Y.description: The y coordinate of the label on the canvas.

Svg.description: Relative path to the svg file for the package.

ClockCanvas.description: The definition of the clock network canvas.

Name.description: The name of the memory range.

Description.description: The description of the memory region.

AddressStart.description: The first address in the region.

AddressEnd.description: The last address in the region.

Width.description: The bit width of an addressable unit.

MinimumAlignment.description: The minimum alignment in bytes of partitions of the memory region.

Access.description: The accessibility of the memory region.

Type.description: The type category of the memory region. Must be one of the system-level MemoryTypes.

Location.description: The location of the memory region.

Name.description: The name of the referenced memory region.

AddressStart.description: The first physical address in the region, if different from referenced memory.

AddressEnd.description: The last physical address in the region, if different from referenced memory.

Access.description: The accessibility of the memory region.

AliasType.description: The reference to the alias for this memory region.

AliasBaseAddress.description: The base address of the region, if an alias.

additionalProperties.description: The property name gives the control identifier.
The property name gives the enum value of the control.

OpInfo.description: Performance characteristics of an AI Operator

Name.description: Name of operator (or operator class)

Cycles.description: Estimated number of core cycles to perform operation

Energy.description: Estimated energy consumed to perform operation (nJ)

Register.description: The register to program. Must match a register name in the registers section.

Field.description: The field in the register to program. Must match a field name in the register in the registers section.

Value.description: Expression for value to set the field to.

InverseValue.description: Expression value to compute the control value from the field value.

Operation.description: Apply the operation to the register field.

Wait.description: Wait for a given number of milliseconds after the step.
